com.wm.app.b2b.server.jms.consumer

Class JMSTriggerGroupFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wm.app.b2b.server.jms.consumer.JMSTriggerGroupFacade

  • public class JMSTriggerGroupFacade
extends java.lang.Object
    JMSTriggerGroupFacade is a utility class for quickly creating, deleting, and listing JMS triggers that belong to JMS trigger groups. A JMS trigger group is a collection of nearly identical JMS triggers where each trigger uses a different JMS connection alias to point to different Universal Messaging realms.

    • Method Detail

      • getTriggerGroups

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getTriggerGroups()
                                                                                              throws JMSSubsystemException
        Retrieves data about all trigger groups on the Integration Server.
        Returns:
        a map representing the trigger groups. Each map entry contains the trigger group name as the key, and an ArrayList of Strings containing the name of the JMS triggers.
        Throws:
        JMSSubsystemException - if an error occurs

      • getTriggerGroupsAsData

        public static IData[] getTriggerGroupsAsData()
                                      throws JMSSubsystemException
        Retrieves trigger group data, in the form of IData, for all the trigger groups in loaded packages on Integration Server.
        Returns:
        IData[] representing the trigger groups. Each IData entry includes information about an individual trigger group, including the group name, the names of each trigger in the group, the trigger group ID for the trigger, and the name of the JMS connection alias used by the trigger,
        Throws:
        JMSSubsystemException - if an internal error occurs.

      • createTrigger

        public static java.lang.String createTrigger(java.lang.String sourceTriggerName,
                                             java.lang.String targetAliasName,
                                             java.lang.String targetTriggerGroupId,
                                             java.lang.String targetPackageName)
                                      throws JMSSubsystemException
        Creates a new JMS trigger by copying an existing JMS trigger and specifying a different JMS connection alias. The new trigger name will include the original trigger name plus a suffix that includes JMS trigger group tag and the trigger group Id. That is: folder.subfolder:originalJmsTriggerName_triggerGroupTag_Id Note that the JMS trigger group tag is configurable via the watt.server.jms.trigger.groupTag property. The default value is WMTG.
        Parameters:
        sourceTriggerName - the name of the JMS trigger you are copying.
        targetAliasName - the JMS connection alias to assign to the new trigger.
        targetTriggerGroupId - the Id appended to the end of the new trigger
        targetPackageName - the package in which to create the new trigger
        Returns:
        the name of the new JMS trigger
        Throws:
        JMSSubsystemException - thrown if an error occurs.

      • createTriggers

        public static IData[] createTriggers(java.lang.String targetAliasName,
                                     java.lang.String targetTriggerGroupId,
                                     java.lang.String targetPackageName)
                              throws JMSSubsystemException
        Creates a new trigger by copying every JMS trigger in a loaded package in Integration Server and specifying a different JMS connection alias. Every new trigger name will include the original trigger name plus a suffix that includes the JMS trigger group tag and the trigger group Id. That is: folder.subfolder:originalJmsTriggerName_triggerGroupTag_Id Note that the JMS trigger group tag is configurable via the watt.server.jms.trigger.groupTag property. The default value is WMTG.
        Parameters:
        targetAliasName - the JMS connection alias to assign to the new triggers.
        targetTriggerGroupId - the Id to append to the end of the new trigger names
        targetPackageName - the package in which to create the new triggers
        Returns:
        IData a list of the names of the JMS trigger that Integration Server attempted to create along with the status of each attempt, where status can be success or the exception that caused trigger creation to fail.
        Throws:
        JMSSubsystemException - thrown if an error occurs

      • createTriggersForAlias

        public static IData[] createTriggersForAlias(java.lang.String sourceAliasName,
                                             java.lang.String targetAliasName,
                                             java.lang.String targetTriggerGroupId,
                                             java.lang.String targetPackageName)
                                      throws JMSSubsystemException
        Creates a copy of every JMS trigger that uses a specific JMS connection alias in Integration Server. You can specify which JMS connection alias the new JMS triggers will use to connect to the JMS provider. Every new trigger name will include the original trigger name plus a suffix that includes the JMS trigger group tag and a trigger group Id. That is: folder.subfolder:originalJmsTriggerName_triggerGroupTag_Id Note that the JMS trigger group tag is configurable via the watt.server.jms.trigger.groupTag property. The default value is WMTG.
        Parameters:
        sourceAliasName - the name of the JMS connection alias used by the JMS triggers for which you want to create copies
        targetAliasName - the JMS connection alias to assign to the new triggers.
        targetTriggerGroupId - the Id to append to the end of the new trigger names
        targetPackageName - the package in which to create the new triggers
        Returns:
        IData a list of all trigger names that Integration Server attempted to create along with the status of each attempt. If trigger creation failed, includes a the exception that caused failure.
        Throws:
        JMSSubsystemException - thrown if an error occurs

      • deleteTriggersForGroupId

        public static IData[] deleteTriggersForGroupId(java.lang.String triggerGroupId)
                                        throws JMSSubsystemException
        Deletes all the JMS triggers in a JMS trigger group whose name contains the specified trigger group Id. For example, calling deleteTriggersForGroupId("abc") would delete triggers my.trigger1_WMTG_abc and my.trigger2_WMTG_abc.
        Parameters:
        triggerGroupId - the name of the JMS trigger group Id contained in the names of the JMS triggers that you want to delete
        Returns:
        IData a list of the names of the JMS triggers that Integration Server attempted to delete along with the status of each delete attempt. If a JMS trigger could not be deleted, the exception that prevented deletion is included.
        Throws:
        JMSSubsystemException - thrown if an internal error occurs

      • getTriggersInGroup

        public static java.lang.String[] getTriggersInGroup(java.lang.String groupId)
                                             throws JMSSubsystemException
        Retrieves a list of all the JMS triggers whose names contain a specific JMS trigger group Id.
        Returns:
        a String[] of the names of JMS trigger that are in a JMS trigger group and contain the specified trigger group Id
        Throws:
        JMSSubsystemException - thrown if an error occurs
